info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 04 at 2:56PM PDT until November 07 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Somes areas of higher terrain could see snow amounts between 8 and 14 inches. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 4000 feet in Siskiyou County including portions of Sawyers Bar road near Mt. Etna and north of the Forks of Salmon; Highway 96 and between the Seiad Valley and Happy Camp; and Highway 3 east of Fort Jones. This also includes the Mt. Shasta Ski Park, Highway 97, Bray, Tennant, and Highway 89 at Snowmans Summit and Dead Horse Summit. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates could approach an inch an hour at times, especially for higher terrain. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
